rComments: Really wants you to succeed. She's very friendly and it was an incredibly interesting seminar.

I can't stress enough how awesome Prof Anderson is. I take every course that she offers. She is also extremely helpful outside of the classroom and is super easy to talk to. Definitely take one (or many) of her courses if you get the chance!!

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. All of her tests are open notebook and it is easy to guess which topics will be on the exam. The essays are split up into multiple graded components which makes time management easier. I actively look for her classes to take them because I love her teaching style so much.

Christy Anderson is an amazing professor. She explains the course material really well and her lectures are always engaging and fun to listen to. Her assignments are fun to do and she helps you a lot with the assignments. She is a fair grader and gives you useful feedback. Overall, you really learn from Christy and she is very inspirational :)

Prof. Anderson is seriously the best prof ever. I took her FAH270 and 370 and she's so amazing. Not only are her classes insanely easy (all tests open book) she's so passionate so it makes the material super easy to digest. She's funny, quirky, and so nice. She really wants her students to succeed. So inspirational, probably the best prof I've had.
She is really arrogant, and rude to students. Worst art history class experience at U of T.

This is my second course with Prof Anderson and I couldn't be happier I got her again. She delivers her lectures (in this course, as well as in my first course with her, FAH102) almost like narratives - she'll tell the history part like a story, weaving in architectural concepts and structures (i.e. buildings/examples for your tests/projects/exam).

Your group members are chosen for the main project so your mark is left in the hands of others. She used the program TopHat for the first time this year (2016) because before that she didn't allow technology; THE PROGRAM IS A TOTAL JOKE- its always messing up and she doesn't know how to use it. Awful; unless you are pursuing art its not worth it.

Firstly, Christy Anderson is an amazing lecturer. Not only does she teach interesting material, she is also well organized and brings a certain level of personality to class you don't see with many Professors. Anybody who complained about her on here clearly didn't put in the work to get a decent grade. It is university, grades come with the work.

the lecture is really really interesting, but there are a lot of reading every week and if you don't read them all you won't pass the test because the test can be anything in the textbook. the book is the disaster and the TAs are hard markers.
She lies to her students about the grading system. Her TAs are the hardest markers ever!!! She acts like she cares about the students but that's a big lie.
Anderson was hilarious and her lectures were fun! Long readings, and tough material, but she made the course interesting and the assignments were pretty easy.

I loved her lectures. She presented the material as part of a series of narratives in architecture history discourse, which made learning very enjoyable. Some of her "tips" on how to do well in course were a little naive though. If you treat the assignments like regular academic assignments then you'll do well.

Gathering the required course readingsresources is tedious & time wasting. In her effort to be current by using blogs, youtube, wikis, drop boxes, FADIS, blackboard, & online lectures as resources creates so much overhead for students to keep up with it just becomes a huge time suck for them. Technology is not her forte & students suffer for it.

Poor course organization--she's all over the place. She posts some files on FADIS, blackboard, drop box, a blog. She always has technical difficulties. She's tardy with file uploads. I believe in investing my time in studying, not spending my time trying to find the required resources to study because of her ineptitude and lack of preparedness.

There is a lot of readings in this class (make sure you don't fall behind with the readings). Instructions are unclear as to what she expects and what she will be on the midterm and exam. But she really wants the class to do well and learn the materials. And her lectures are enjoyable.
very clear lectures, speaks well, not boring

Absolutely amazing.  Very passionate about architecture and wants students to succeed.  Very approachable, intelligent and friendly!  Make use of the time you have to interact with her - it will go far.  Hard work pays off.

Attempted to discuss and have students understand too many work. The subject matter could have been covered effectively if I had a two hour lecture in this every night for course for a year instead of the total 24 hours in class that attempted to have you fully understand the various and complex intentions of hundreds of structures.
she comes across as tough, and there is a lot of readings per class.. but you will learn a lot and appreciate the work you did

One of my favourite professors at U of T for sure.  I looked forward to her lectures every week, they were exciting and interesting, and her passion for the subject is contagious.  My positive learning experiences in her classes is making me seriously consider studying architectural history for my master's degree. SHE'S AWESOME!
She was unhelpful when prompt during office hours. The reading assigned were ridiculous.

great prof. lectures are great and theyre pretty much all you need - i've done only...two readings. (make up) midterm was so easy, got an A+ and A- on assignment 1.  you dont really need the book - its 100 bucks for only a half-credit course.
wonderful woman, I loved her course and her lol, shes sweet and very helpful the best prof I've had by far

SHE IS UNBELIEVABLE! Amazing teacher, her clarity in the topics she picks is amazing.she makes you understand the piece that she shows you to the bone. had three courses with her and I can still remember what she said about each building!AMAZING!AMAZING!AMAZING!

Prof Anderson is what university should be about. She is always available for extra help and tries to make students understand that art history is not just about memorising dates - its about understanding why the art/architecture was created and its effect on socety as a whole.  This was the best course I've taken at UofT so far!!

She is the best professor I have had at UofT. Her teaching is a shining exemple of what higher education ought to be. Her lectures sometimes brings me close to tears when she helps you really *see* the innate beauty of the architecture. Her assignments are genuine teaching tools that forces you to think and learn. A demanding and satisfying course.
One of the BEST professors at the University. She is a wonderful woman. I can't see how anyone could not take her class being in Fine Art.
SHE IS UNBELIVABLE!
Classes are fun and the topics were very interesting.
great sense of humor = great professor. Anderson is definitely the best professor at the fine art/architecture history department
She is very enthusiastic and easy to listen to.  Possibly the best professor I have had at U of T
Those 'Anderson Assignments' really make you think! Not just great prof, but a great person.

Expect the unexpected! Very unorthodox assignments that are exciting yet challenging. A lot of the resources for the course are accessible from home (lectures, email announcements, library research guide, etc). Very approachable and well organized.
Ha!  This site is wicked.  But yeah, Prof. Anderson was probably the greatest teacher I've had at U of T.  I mean that.
simply fabulous.  makes a valiant attempt to undo the mind numbing U of T conditioning and lets us think for ourselves.

Not your typical UofT prof so be ware of interesting lectures, fair grading, and a totally different approach to the teaching of art history! Very enthusiastic about the material and makes sure YOU are too.

Very enthusiastic and funny!! Her attitude towrds the material makes it hard to lose concentration! Doesn't care about memorizing or ask for specifics, but wants your own input. I look forward for her lectures every week

very knowledgable and interesting. does not require memorisation bs. focuses on few pieces and looks for original insight and personal opinion. very interesting and well organized class,easy to follow her.
